title: Ticket #3406: Jobs that cannot be removed
description:
An authorized user can create a job that is not removable. Such a beast is quite annoying for the admin to manage as you have to turn off the schedd and hand-edit the job_queue.log.

This can be done via the Qmgr client interface - simply submit a job without the JobStatus attribute (use condor_submit -dump to generate a valid ad, remove JobStatus, and then send the job to the schedd). The JobStatus attribute appears to be required for any Remove / RemoveX action.

The schedd should validate the attributes of any incoming job as opposed to relying on condor_submit to "do the right thing".
